website_summaries.verdict: Those looking for a fast, accurate corded chainsaw will enjoy this highly-rated model, complete with a powerful motor and automatic oiling system.
pros: No tools needed to adjust chain tension
Starts up quickly once plugged in, unlike gas chainsaws
The integrated bar will stop the saw if it's kicked back against the user
Clear window indicates when oil level is low
Included manual gives helpful common cutting tips
cons: Limited to how close the chainsaw is to an electrical outlet

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough to assemble but never even kicked
customer_reviews.text: Dead on Arrival. Easy enough to assemble but never even kicked on. UPDATE: Holy hell their support is awful. They want me to drive this thing and hour and a half to a service center that wants me to pay them a deposit to repair the chainsaw under warranty. Definitely avoiding Black and Decker from now on
customer_reviews.author: Jack Burton

customer_reviews.title: But this is really nice. The size of trees this thing can handle ...
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't wild about the idea of owning an electric chain saw. But this is really nice. The size of trees this thing can handle will amaze you. Uses very little oil at each use. Very sharp chain that stays sharp for a very long time. I have mine to cut down trees 20" in diameter and have cut a lot of firewood with it, and still haven't had to sharpen the chain. Still goes through the wood like butter. The instant stoppage of the chain as soon as the trigger is released is a real nice safety feature. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Military Vet

customer_reviews.title: Mine was defective.
customer_reviews.text: I can only speak for my experience, but I received a defective unit. Followed assembly directions, checked twice to make sure all was set, put the anti kickback shield in the correct position, added oil as directed. And it would not work, except once when it worked for about a second. Used outlets and cords that I double checked for operability. I bought the Worx 18 inch electric instead, which comes completely assembled, and I had no problems. ISO this review is for the unit I received. I can’t speak about one that works properly.
customer_reviews.author: Bitter Enz

customer_reviews.title: Chain bar assembly problem
customer_reviews.text: I received my chainsaw on October 23, 2018 and assembled it. I noticed that the chain bar was not aligned to the sprocket. This could be very dangerous so I didn't use it yet. This may cause the chain to jump out the bar. If running this for long time, the chain or sprocket may damage. I called the black and decker number for asisstance and tolled me to go to the nearest black and decker repair center. Let see what the technician will tell about my problem. If they can fix it, I will update my review. Wish me luck.
customer_reviews.author: EDR

customer_reviews.title: Short lived fun
customer_reviews.text: Saw arrived on time, easy to assemble, had surprising power. That's where the good ends. Cut 6 limbs, then died. Checked all power related issues, the saw is just dead. Ordered because I needed this tree topped this weekend, now have a pretty new saw to return and lost time finding a replacement somewhere. If you're a busy person, or looking to save money and headaches, avoid this saw online.
customer_reviews.author: Forsaken

customer_reviews.title: Eats wood like a starving rabid termite!
customer_reviews.text: We were hit by hurricane Florence in Jacksonville, NC. Plenty of downed trees of varying sizes. I had a Remington electric 16 inch that blew a sprocket (it was made of plastic), just couldn't handle the stress. All saws sold out of every store in the area. Ordered this saw and arrived within a few days. Easy setup. I truly appreciate the knob for the tension. Oil use surprisingly minimal. This thing cuts through wood like butter. I cut multiple trees bigger than 22inch and it never sputtered. This saw is my new best friend. Thank you B & D for such a great product and thank you Amazon for the quick shipment during my time of need.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. I purchased this in May only having used this a few times and this is already broken. Of course it's past the time to be able to return for a new one or refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk, Chain won't stay on.
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw is a piece of junk. I have had good luck with other Black & Decker equipment, but the chain won't stay on even without trying to cut anything. If you buy this, be sure you get it assembled and tested before the return window closes or you'll be stuck with an expensive piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: DOA on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this and get to work. Much to my chagrin, after adding chain oil and getting a new extension cord, the unit would not start. Checked assembly, brake and outlets but nothing! Very disappointed as I had set aside the day to use it. Returned it and cut everything by hand. Great return policy but couldn’t return the chain oil since I used it.
customer_reviews.author: info overload

customer_reviews.title: Great saw, if you use the correct cord.
customer_reviews.text: The best electric chainsaw, hands down. I would like to know what cord the users who said it failed after several uses had used. Most standard 16g extension cords cannot allow 15 amps to be pulled. You will need to use a 12g or larger extension cord, other wise you'll starve the motor. Just a 2% drop in voltage could cause a motor to overheat and fail. A 16g vs a 12g could result in a 50% drop in voltage and that's just free spinning. This doesn't account extra load while cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Shafer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set up and Buy the Warranty
customer_reviews.text: For an electric chainsaw for around the house can't beat it. Don't have to be concerned about the noise like a gas chainsaw annoying the neighbors. Made fast work on the 12 inch hickory especially bucking and limbing bought the warranty just in case I break it. This saw is more reliable than my Craftsman gas saw. Update as of 1/28/2020 This saw is amazing cutting up 24 inch diameter white Ash saved my self $350 from a local tree service. When this saw wears out buying another. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: C.Bennett

customer_reviews.title: This Saw Kicks Ash! - YOU MUST USE A 12 GAUGE EXTENSION CORD!
customer_reviews.text: I used this B+D 18" chainsaw to cut-up a seasoned, mature Ash tree (VERY hard wood). The base was about 31 inches in diameter and the length was about 50 feet. The saw had no problems cutting up the whole tree. YOU MUST USE A 12 GAUGE EXTENSION CORD, or you risk over-heating the motor due to a voltage drop. If you keep the chain sharp, this saw will serve you well.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Pro

customer_reviews.title: My new chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: I have been borrowing chainsaws from friends for far too long! We have enough foliage on our property that I need a chainsaw frequently enough to own one. I like this saw. I thought that I would need this long one, but turns out some of the jobs I have to do are above head and smaller branches. This means the chainsaw is a bit too heavy for those jobs. Luckily my mom has her smaller chainsaw stored in my garage, so I can use that! This saw works very well!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 10

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power, pick up some bar oil.
customer_reviews.text: I cut up a 24" yucca tree, some 10" branches on a maple, worked great. Chain bar stayed oiled. I only adjusted the chain tension twice all day. The 18" bar was worth a few extra bucks. If you are able to work with an extension cord, this saw has plenty of power. I used a 50' 12awg cord and let the saw cool down after 20 minutes of use then fired it up again.
customer_reviews.author: Dooki

customer_reviews.title: Very happy to have.
customer_reviews.text: Strong, lightweight, trouble-free, details designed with user's convenience in mind. Before I had gasoline powered, good make, but one trouble after another, and much heavier. This Black & Decker is as strong as a gas-powered. As long as you have a long-enough extension cord. I cannot see any reason for having a gasoline-powered chainsaw. But my very first one was electric, very weak, cheaply made, I threw it away soon. The one which I have now is just perfect, and quite inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Goral

customer_reviews.title: Came in handy after Hurricane Irma
customer_reviews.text: Boy this came in handy after Hurricane Irma. I had fallen trees everywhere, and this little chainsaw with a few extra chains and sharpeners did the trick. Lightweight, easy to use (especially for an older woman) and the safety features are really good. It was really easy to replace the chain and clean the saw after each use. It comes with a chain cover. Gotta love Black and Decker products.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Guerierri

customer_reviews.title: Chain jumped off twice
customer_reviews.text: I literally just got this today and was excited put the blade together as instructed in the manual, filled up the oil reservoir and the plugged it in, started in up and the chain jumped off twice. Very disappointed, I am going to go thru the instructions one more time and try it again, hopefully it works.. If not it is being shipped back to Amazon/
customer_reviews.author: MIllitas Montana

customer_reviews.title: Work's like a Champ!
customer_reviews.text: Its been a long time since I've worked with an electric corded chainsaw so I was pleasantly surprised to see not only how well this one does with my tree cutting but it is the new safety features that I didn't know about or expect to appreciate. You still have to be very careful and conscious about what you are doing when you pull the trigger but the safety features really are an awesome improvement. Plus, the tension adjustment is the best I have ever seen along with the automatic self-oiling feature takes the worry out of worry. Great job, Black & Decker on a really well designed product and a great value through Amazon. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Norman

customer_reviews.title: Like a colony of hangry beavers
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. Chews through trees as you can see. One thing I appreciate is the auto brake... chain immediately stops when you release the trigger. Tension mechanism is also best I’ve seen over the 5 other chainsaws I’ve used. Currently I also own a greenworks 40v cordless and this B&D has way more torque. A couple tips: buy the biggest extension cord you can afford (100’ 12ga would be great) and keep an eye on the oil level... those beavers are thirsty!
customer_reviews.author: Jim in Mountain View

customer_reviews.title: Great Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Had 5 large trees from 16' to 24" base hackberry trees plus trimming up to 8" branches up to 20 feet above ground . I really like this saw as an electric it is safe and not turning until ready to cut. This saw has plenty of power and cut well until I tried cutting a brick caught up in one tree I didn't see. Too much damage to sharpen so I replaced chain and continued. Saved me over $1000 doing it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Zoart

customer_reviews.title: Died after one use.
customer_reviews.text: I used it once and it worked well. The second time I picked it up, it was dead. No nothing. I eliminated power source issues, power cord, etc. as a potential cause. Very disappointing. I was a few weeks past the Amazon return period, so now I have to hunt B&D's nearest service center, which is twenty five miles away, and jack around with all that process.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mullis

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a smaller chainsaw. Because I am a small person, I wanted to make sure I could handle it, but It had to be able to do the job.. This chainsaw really works great..I would recommend it..
customer_reviews.author: Ange

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chainsaw last year and finally got around to using it...wish I had tried last year because this thing DOES NOT WORK! I have sat next to a thin branch for 5 minutes trying to get the sucker to saw through and instead it is just burning the wood.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chain saw that a woman can use as well as a man. Not that heavy and does the job that it was meant to do. I used it to slice already cut down pine trees that were in four foot sections. I sliced three inch slices with ease. Also great for cutting thick branches and cutting down trees if you know what you're doing. The directions show you how to cut down a tree but I would definitely leave that to a man who can yell TIMBER! I purchased this particular one because it was heavy duty and could do multiple tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Janet S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, Good Weight, Good Balance, Can handle more than you think.
customer_reviews.text: Why gas and pull start a chainsaw? This one does a really good job. It downed a medium size redwood with no problem. If you're going to go up to the woods to do logging, you would need a big ol gas one, but this is perfect for home or small acreage use. Good weight, Good balance, Heavy enough without being too heavy for a lady to use.... which I am. I've had lots of experience with gas chain saws, so this lady knows what she's talking about. Husband thinks it is great as well. Just about perfect.
customer_reviews.author: shelleychez

customer_reviews.title: Not a toy
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw is a beast. I tried it out today by bucking up several aspen and pine trees. These are softer wood varieties, but it didn't hesitate even a little. I was worried it may bog down with pressure, but it kept making chips. I had no issues with alignment of the chain, gear, or bar. Oil consumption was as expected. It's lighter than a full sized gas powered chainsaw, but it's also not as light as I was expecting. Absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M&S

customer_reviews.title: if anything else shared the same breaker there's a good chance you can set it off
customer_reviews.text: I've done about 8 full trees of my own and loaned it out post hurricane to cut up some downed trees. For anyone that thinks there saw failed, make sure you check your breaker, this is 15 amps, if anything else shared the same breaker there's a good chance you can set it off, or even if you push the saw vs letting it cut, it will draw over 15.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Nice Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this chainsaw so far. I've only used it once (on several tree's/branches), and it cut really well. I used it on a tree trunk that was about the size of my forearm, and it took a little effort, but I was still able to cut it down. On everything else I cut (that was thinner than that but still to thick to cut down any other way), it was a piece of cake. Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: TruthTeller

customer_reviews.title: love the saw
customer_reviews.text: i loved this saw, works great. easy to use. somebody else thought so too. it was stolen out of my garage. now i have to come up with away to buy a new one. i was using it to cut down a tree in my front yard. i hadn't used it i a few weeks because of being busy for Christmas, so i didn't notice until today when i went to get it to cut up my Christmas tree. the was simple to use and it work like a champ
customer_reviews.author: rob'sdad

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to assemble
customer_reviews.text: After an hour of attempting to attach the chain bar, i gave up and returned item. There was not enough slack in the chain to engage the rotary tensioner threads. Im not mechanically challenged. I can assemble engines and transmissions blind folded.
customer_reviews.author: steven p.

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Never before have a seen a chainsaw held together entirely by one single screw! Very dangerous! Aslo the auto oiler is way out of line.
customer_reviews.author: diggler69

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to take apart/clean
customer_reviews.text: I moved up from an old 14" HomeLife saw when its motor died. This one's a lot more powerful, cuts well, and you can get the bar and chain off without any tools (needed a 10 mm socket and Phillips Screwdriver for the HomeLife. The tensioner assembly has an outer wheel which moves the arm in/out and an inner one you twist to tighten the cover, or loosen until it the cover comes off. You can still adjust bar position without it being fastened. Very clever.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this chainsaw for a couple weeks now, and I’ve used it about 6 times. It worked welll every time. I’ve only used it on relatively small jobs, cutting limbs and stump off an arbor vitae I took out and cutting a maple down that had a 6” diameter trunk. I’m not sure how well this chainsaw we’ll last over time, but so far so good. Note that I’ve followed most of the maintenance ideas suggested in other comments.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brand

customer_reviews.title: Great saw if power is available.
customer_reviews.text: We've had ours for nearly three years and have used it for the jobs our smaller battery-operated chainsaw (also B&D) couldn't handle. Never had a problem with it at any time. The only thing we have seen is that the chain occasionally loosens up while cutting. A quick turn of the knob solves that. I highly recommend this chainsaw for anyone who doesn't want the hassle of maintaining a gas-powered unit.
customer_reviews.author: lhorton

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Chainsaw.  A clear winner.
customer_reviews.text: We love this chainsaw. Used it to remove 6 BIG arbovita bushes that had 6 to 8 "arms" at the root base and were 6 to 8 inches in diameter to cut through at ground level. Had to tension the chain a couple of times during each bush which is easy. It didn't use excessive chain lube from the automatic chain oiling system. Had MORE than enough power. It is light enough that one handed use is possible. Overall .... wow. A winner.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie L Stevens

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't run right out of the box. No product support online to even try to troubleshoot.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Had 2 weeks and tensioner already broke, goes through oil like crazy and the design where tensioner is....well not good in my opinion. I'm pretty disappointed that is broke already. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Maura

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chainsaw for the homeowner
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this saw in 2017 and it's still running strong. Just got done dropping a 100 ft pinetree with no problems. I love the fact that I can use this, wipe it off and store it until next time without the worry of gas and oil. Ive ran through 3 chains since purchased and will definitely buy another chainsaw when this one finally dies on me.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Defective Leaks Chainsaw oil
customer_reviews.text: I also noticed that the chainsaw blade was also not sharp enough for repeated cutting of a single tree. I had only used it a few times on that one tree when i have noticed that it was leaking oil.
customer_reviews.author: Gamer02

customer_reviews.title: A great saw for light duty trimming.
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a Christmas present and have waited to review it until I had used it a couple of times. I am pleasantly surprised as to how well it cuts. This is the perfect saw for someone like me who only needs it to cut up tree limbs that have fallen in the yard or to trim up overgrown shrubs. I would not count on it for cutting a full year's worth of firewood. Fairly easy to assemble if you just take time and think it through. Don't forget to buy some chainsaw oil. None comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, safe, easy to maintain
customer_reviews.text: Great chainsaw. Powerful and easy to maintain with nice safety features. Make sure you check chain tension frequently and adjust if necessary, which is very easy to do. Also clean the chain after each use. It's hefty but well balanced. Good instructions on how to assemble and adjust. Very helpful instructions on how to make various cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Nando

customer_reviews.title: UNSTABLE BAR AND CHAIN
customer_reviews.text: AFTER SLIGHT USE THE BAR AND CHAIN ARE NOT SECURE - THEY BECOME LOOSE AND UNSTABLE - THE HAND TIGHTENING MECHANISM IS USELESS - THEY HAVE TO CHANGE THE DESIGN. USE A BOLT TIGHTENING SYSTEM.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Black and decker does it again!!
customer_reviews.text: Like a hot knife through butter baby!! I was skeptical about an electric chainsaw but wow this saw cuts through trees like nothing. Really impressed. I’ve never owned a chainsaw and needed to take down a couple of medium sized trees and branches and it did the job perfectly. Going to finish up later with some larger branches to open up a natural canopy in the front yard. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Red Cardinal 1

customer_reviews.title: Following the Common Cutting Techniques in the manual for Felling I was able to easily remove it
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. I had a dead medium-large tree in my yard. Following the Common Cutting Techniques in the manual for Felling I was able to easily remove it. Absolutely have wedges and a heavy hammer near to be sure the tree falls in the correct direction.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Many tree branches to cut
customer_reviews.text: Storm knocked a lot of branches onto my property (luckily my house not hit), and township offered to pickup all debris left at curb for 2 weeks. Ordered chainsaw (had broken 2 previous ones), cause big enough for branches and electric (not a fan of gas). Keep the chainsaw oiled at all tines, and plowed thru a lot of wood. Was perfect for the job I needed, and in my prices range. And township picked up all the wood, not picked up by those wanting firewood.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tabel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Electric saw!
customer_reviews.text: Would definitely buy this one again. This 18" 15 Amp chews through the biggest of the big. Although not really designed for such a heavy load, it performed fantastic with the 24 yr old redwood stump I needed to bring down closer to ground level for grinder work. As for tension and chain coming loose, its all about proper tension. Set it up correctly and it will do the job without issue. Had to change the chain out but then again I was really pushing this thing. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Michelangelo

customer_reviews.title: Once assembled, tears through wood very well. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled, tears through wood very well. I have used it for bucking out 8-12" diameter trees. The mechanism for adjusting (tightening) the blade is cumbersome and causes me to "grit my teeth". The performance is worth the initial fret.
customer_reviews.author: Archie E Dalton

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: We followed all instructions, used the correct oil, tightened the chain properly. We cut a few branches that were about three inches in diameter. Then the machine simply stopped working. We tried taking it apart and putting it back together. We tried different outlets and extension cords. It apparently died after about twenty minutes of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannette Sachs

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Storms dropped several nice sized hardwoods in my back yard. Because I burn wood, these trees were destined for the stove. I already owned a 24" gas powered saw, but wanted something lighter and easier to work while topping out the smaller limbs and branches. Cue the 18" electric saw. At only 12 lbs, this saw is working perfectly in this capacity. It's lightweight, easy to manage, and does a fine job cutting small size diameters. Once the light work is completed...then my larger saw can take over for the really big cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am seriously blown away with this chainsaw's performance! I own two 20" 50cc gas saws. Been using them for years, but this little baby is light, comfortable, and easy to use. It handles well and has lots of power. It is allot quieter, too. Idea for use in my yard. It doesn't use much chain oil, either. I give it a strong 5 STARS!
customer_reviews.author: Gern B.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice saw.
customer_reviews.text: Certainly did everything it was supposed to. I bought this because of a terrific sale. It cost me less than a one day rental. At Amazon's normal price I probably would have rented or gone cordless. Regardless, it's a very nice electric chain saw. And folks, for as often as I'll use it it wouldn't surprise me if it was used by my grandchildren some day.😉
customer_reviews.author: Charles W. Weinstock

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I have several B&D chainsaws with rechargeable batteries, but I needed something bigger and electric seemed like a good idea. I'm cutting down oleander and the trunks are massive. This chainsaw makes the trunks quick work! It's heavy and torque-y, but it's a workhorse and gets the job done quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: B& D came  through again with a great little piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Great little Chain Saw, for this and that around the years. Easy to handle ( my husband says). It starts right up. And shuts off right away too. No pulling a cord. I bought an extra chain for later, so have not written review on it. Price is good.
customer_reviews.author: Dollymop22

customer_reviews.title: So much better than a gas chainsaw for a typical homeowner!
customer_reviews.text: Put oil in the reservoir for the chain, plug it in and push the button. So easy to use and it's great not dealing with gas and priming it and then pulling a starter cord a million times to start it. I used to get tired just getting a gas chainsaw started, never mind actually cutting a tree down. I really recommend an electric chainsaw for casual use by a typical homeowner. Easier to store and use than a gas chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Zarifis

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: My first chainsaw and I love it! Received as a Christmas gift (my choice). When we just had a warm front pass through, I had a chance to test it out. Assembled easily, just make sure you buy oil. Husband gave me a 5 minute lesson then I cut down a 20ft tree! No big main trunk, tree was 6 small trunks about 3 inches wide each. Cut everything easily.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa J

customer_reviews.title: I waited to use it, now I'm waiting to fix it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year to clear out some woody weeds in an area behind the house. However, I didn't realize there wasn't bar oil in the box. By the time I got around to buying some, I make six (6) cuts and the chain is dull. Does that seem right? Now I'm waiting to buy a replacement chain or figure out how to sharpen the one I have. I don't remember having this much trouble with a previous cordless B&D chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: J. Frahm

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by how well it works
customer_reviews.text: Works well and has a lot of power for an electric chainsaw. In fact, I've been using it primarily for a small chainsaw mill I put together. The electric motor doesn't bother my neighbors as much as a gas unit would. The saw has seen many hours of use at this point (with walnut and maple logs) and is still going strong. Quite happily surprised with this saw overall.
customer_reviews.author: alexander n roberts

customer_reviews.title: It is incredibly reasonable in price and is a great saw for anybody
customer_reviews.text: This is my first chainsaw and after having used others in the past and hearing horror stories about them, I was skeptical going into it. The chainsaw is very safe to operate and adjust. The instructions clearly illustrate the proper way to take care of and use this tool as well. It is incredibly reasonable in price and is a great saw for anybody. I wish I had bought this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: colesloth

customer_reviews.title: won't tighten
customer_reviews.text: Chain simply won't tighten. I don't know if a piece is missing or what, but something's not right. The "support" website is useless.
customer_reviews.author: T. M. Sell

customer_reviews.title: Good performer.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Stihl 029 farm horse (heavy duty) gas saw that just stopped working. This B&D saw isn’t as powerful of course but for this price, it cut everything I needed, even 20” diameter tree. A bit slower of course but again, not a problem. The clutch stops the chain in less than a second once the trigger is release.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Gabai

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw with a lot of power
customer_reviews.text: Nice saw with a lot of power. I don't need gas powered anymore but every now and then I do need a chain saw. This has the power and no hassle of starting and maintenance a gas saw. If you are going to be using a chainsaw a lot, get a gas one but for occasional use this is a great saw. A good starter saw if you have big trees and never used a chainsaw before.
customer_reviews.author: Allen C

customer_reviews.title: Great Chainsaw- Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Love this saw. Had to cut down many medium size trees so we had room in the backyard for a trampoline. We checked websites and this one had great reviews. We have been very happy with our choice. Best feature is the chain itself. We have had problems with other saws because the chain kept slipping off and they are very difficult to put back on. You almost need two people to hold and tighten. This one has not slipped off once!
customer_reviews.author: chris pankuch

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw, But Why An 8" Replacement Chain?
customer_reviews.text: This saw is terrific, except I just went to replace the chain and found out the "replacement chain" isn't for this saw...So what value does that bring? So confused as to why that is included. Now I can't chainsaw, because I need to buy a new chain that fits. Not sure what to do with an 8" chain...
customer_reviews.author: Corey & Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This chain saw has saved me so much money by not having to hire tree cutting services. I got a quote for roughly $700 so I decided to buy this chain saw and give it a shot at saving me some money. I was able to cut all of the trees, save the money, let my dad and cousin both borrow it, and still have a chain saw leftover instead of not buying it and wasting $700.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: This saw is a beast
customer_reviews.text: We spent the weekend breaking in this puppy. 1st off, there is a great safety feature that prevents people from getting hurt. The blade is a great size for what we need. over the last 10 years we had about 5 THICC trees fall in the yard. Finished 3 of them sat/sun and split most of it too.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Treacy

customer_reviews.title: Lack of confidence
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of the CS1518 black & decker chainsaws that lasted at best 15 minutes before the power switch failed to turn on the saw. I thought, what the heck, it's Black and Decker. Maybe just a fluke. Let's order a replacement. Was I ever WRONG! The replacement unit that I received DID NOT EVEN POWER ON THE FIRST TIME!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H.

customer_reviews.title: Good but large trees are gonna take work
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw gets the job done effectively and efficiently for smaller needed cuts. For massive trunks this requires quite a bit more effort and strength to cut through. All in all I’m happy with this purchase because unlike other suppliers it did not take multiple purchases or weeks upon weeks to receive once on order.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Won't turn back after a few use. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Pascal B.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this chainsaw, got it, but it wouldn't work. Sent it back and got a second one. It worked for a summer, used it maybe half a dozen times. Then put it away for the winter. Eventually got it out again and not only would it not start, but it had leaked oil all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Works great, after the learning curve of installing the chain. My only complaint is that it is quite heavy. A nice safety feature is that the chain stops immediately when you let go of the power switch.
customer_reviews.author: Mojave Narrows

customer_reviews.title: One year in and I’m very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a house and the lot was almost all Buckthorn in the backyard. I have run in to some pretty big, gnarly buckthorn trees and this little guy has handled them all. I just began trying to cut down a large tree that had fallen many years ago, trunk about 15-16 inches and with a little effort this machine is cutting it up. I’m very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cattlogix

customer_reviews.title: Got plenty of power for the homeowner
customer_reviews.text: I'm no expert on using chainsaws, so am a little nervous, but this saw has a brake on the chain which very quickly stops the blade when releasing the trigger. Seems very save, easy to use, and had plenty of power. When reaching over the head, tho, it did get a little heavy. But then, I'm getting older.....
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Too easy.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, effective, easy to adjust - virtually maintenance free, compared to gas powered chain saws. I needed a cheap saw to use while on a ladder, that I could drop if something were to happen to threaten my safety. This saw is light, and perhaps encourages users to do too much without thinking things through. The saw has enough guts to quickly cut through 5-6" maple and oak limbs. I wouldn't use it for too much bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Keith R.

customer_reviews.title: This is a powerful chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Chainsaw for cutting down trees. Maple and Oak trees up to a foot and a half in diameter have been felled and made into axeable rounds with ease. The chain sharpens well, the oil reservoir is large enough and the saw handles well. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Murphy-Naughton

customer_reviews.title: bad motor
customer_reviews.text: i use this only one day and its not working any more its bad motor and i cant return it because return window was only 30 days and i used just last week and brook same day bad buy...
customer_reviews.author: rana jabbar

customer_reviews.title: Exellent product far surpasses compeditive products in this price range...
customer_reviews.text: I am glad that Black & Decker market another quality product that surpresses most in this category of Corded Chainsaw. Performance is just exellent and the added stop chain feature will certainly help To reduce evidentes by first time users.....all in all an excellent product for the price..... Go Black $ Decker......you gut my vote.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this to "texture" a couple hundred board feet of white oak. since this wood was finish material for cabinet fronts, i used it without bar oil. the bar and chain got pretty hot, but the saw did the job i needed it for. obviously, i cant testify as to the tool's longevity, but for me, it paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: David Y.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little saw...good value for the right jobs.
customer_reviews.text: Nice easy to start and light enough to handle in most situations. I went in with this knowing it wasn't going to cut down oak trees I don't need it for that but, it handily does the job of cutting up fallen branches, pruning and cutting up firewood. I did also order an extra chain to have on board.
customer_reviews.author: Deke dasilva

customer_reviews.title: I'm satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for me. I cut up a large tree stump (26 inch diameter) and six foot tall without too much difficulty. I cut it into six pieces and it took a couple of hours. I would stop every fifteen minutes or so to keep the motor from overheating. The wood was weathered and very hard but it did the job. Never had the chain come off as some reviewers stated. I just made sure to tighten the chain every so often.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Was Exceptionally Happy
customer_reviews.text: Was very happy with this saw. During the winter we had a tree fall on out fence. We put this saw together, added the oil and cut the tree up with no problem. It went through a 10 inch around tree with no effort. I can say that electric chainsaws have come a long way. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: blach decker chain saw stay away and from
customer_reviews.text: used three times when doa 😘 tried calling customer support waiting 1 hrs connection to overseas they could not hear me and hung up.. Return expired on aug 7th... so im sol....
customer_reviews.author: WOODY  D

customer_reviews.title: Great price, works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Great price, works like a charm! I used to dislike electric tools that usually use a gas engine, but no more! No mixing fuel and fighting to get the thing started (and to keep it running!). Just plug it in and squeeze the trigger! If one has access to electric power at the site and a long bar is not required, (more than 18"), this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: bobc

customer_reviews.title: Light, comfortable  pace and powerful  enough for the occasional  job.
customer_reviews.text: Snowzilla blew down one of my evergreens so I figured I'd cut it up myself, instead of hiring a service, Robert Frost style. About 25 feet tall and 8" at the trunk. This saw went through it without ever stalling or kicking back. Nice and light it took about an hour. It doesn't cut real fast like my Stihl saw but does the job at a nice easy pace. Its actually light enough to trim trees and thick hedges. For the price and ease of use highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Krause

customer_reviews.title: Nice transition into AC/DC. Greatly needed, less to maintain.
customer_reviews.text: Yes. The cord. In the way, not in the way, problem or no problem? It doesn't matter. The saw is as described. Directly from box to cutting cedar logs, this saw did it with little effort. Enough power for what needed to be cut without blowing a breaker. lol My main reason for the purchase was to rid myself of fixing gas powered chainsaws. So far, no disappointments and A congratulations to B&D for another USA product built to (last). Yes, no, maybe?!...anyway, mikey likey emb
customer_reviews.author: emb

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is my first saw, it was heavier than I expected but that’s not a problem for me. I was concerned that this is one on the cheaper side, but it doesn’t feel cheap at all, it feels solid and well made. I have even dropped it a couple tomes and it didn’t break or anything. Note that this doesn’t come with oil, so you better grab some bar oil. It’s not expensive, $4 a quarter but just take that into consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price saw
customer_reviews.text: Like this saw, do the job for 30-40 min and use tank of oil which on chainsaw. This would do to cut one middle tree. If you buy one bottle of oil to use for this saw that will last for 5 times, do your calculations how much oil you need to buy. Definitely saw for home use not commercial.
customer_reviews.author: Bogdan

customer_reviews.title: Great chain saw
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. Easy to assemble chain. I like the hook to keep the cord out the way. Great power to cut branches and small trees. I minor complaint is that the chain oil was not included. Overall, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Cardell

customer_reviews.title: Got me by
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts for this electric saw. As I just needed to cut up some small trees, I bought this and was surprised at how well it did. It wont cut down big trees, but good for small ones
customer_reviews.author: Dan Haden

customer_reviews.title: Strong saw!
customer_reviews.text: Strong saw. Cut some pretty solid stuff - up to maybe 8" diameters - and it buzzed right thru. Seems very well made. Easy to take the chain on and off - even for me! Only had it our 2 days - but already a big fan.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Foley

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Less Than 8 Months
customer_reviews.text: The chainsaw quit working in less than 8 months. Garage kept and never wet. Plugged it up one day and it doesn’t work. Used less than 5 times with less than 2 hours total work time. We tried multiple outlets however this did not help. Had to throw it away. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Nash

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small home projects
customer_reviews.text: We lost 3 apple trees to fire-blight in our backyard and they needed to come down. This chainsaw was the perfect tool for the job. It cuts well, is lightweight, and a great value. It has a nice chain brake and the chain dis-engages immediately after letting go of the trigger (as the motor spins down). The only thing you need to worry about is managing the cord.
customer_reviews.author: gorreskime

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing for work where you have electricity.
customer_reviews.text: This saw has plenty of power to cut with. No bogging down on thick cuts and seems to use bar/chain oil at a reasonable rate.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ashcraft

customer_reviews.title: Good saw
customer_reviews.text: Bought fir my mom at her request.she had my nephew cut a bunch of low hanging and dead limbs .said it worked great and he said it was a good saw.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Salmon

customer_reviews.title: second one's a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and received this saw, spent 8 hours trying to install the bar and chain, impossible. Returned the saw. Amazon sent a replacement saw, took less than 1 minute to install the bar and chain, adjustment works fine. It turns out that the adjustment mechanism on the 1st saw was installed on the bar "backwards", hence it could not be installed. Unfortunately, there was no way of knowing this since there were no detailed pictures of the device. Haven't used the saw yet other than to run it to be sure that it all works. It runs quietly and smoothly and I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: mhz

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for a customer and she loves it but ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a customer and she loves it but is not computer savvy so I am reviewing for her. She is 71 and very active and actually able to use this lightweight electric saw herself.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Viers

customer_reviews.title: Best electric chainsaw under $100
customer_reviews.text: Powerful, inexpensive, relatively light weight, but big enough to handle large limbs and small tree trunks. Never missed a beat in 2 days of heavy cutting. I expect this product will last me a long time. Best electric chainsaw for under a hundred bucks that I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good enought for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I like it. If you're cutting down redwoods for a living, you're going to think this is too small and not powerful enough. But for my 1.0 wooded acre in the SE, it takes care of my occasional tree problem just fine. The chain needed sharpening sooner than I would have expected, but maybe that's normal
customer_reviews.author: Barney

customer_reviews.title: This saw is very powerful, and seems to be ...
customer_reviews.text: This saw is very powerful, and seems to be well made. I have an almost new 18 in. gas saw, but in my 60s and I just had to much trouble getting it started, and keeping gas/oil mix around. every use would turn into an all day job just to cut for 10 min. or so. now A 10 min. job takes 10 min. for remote jobs i slide my generator in the back of my truck. treat it gently and let the chain do the work, and it should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for Homeowner
customer_reviews.text: I needed a chainsaw that had some decent power and safety options to clear up felled trees from this winters storms. This chain saw assembled relatively easily ( probably would have been extremely easy if I had actually followed instructions and grabbed some gloves ). It has done exactly what I needed it to do. It's a great little unit for a homeowner with a small lot or a small generator to run it. It has an ideal balance of power and cost. I've used it to cut up most of a large tree and it's running well still.
customer_reviews.author: C Bell

customer_reviews.title: light weight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I am a 66 year old female and I have cut trees 14 inch diameter with no hesitation. I only regret that I don't have enough heavy duty extension cords to reach the back of my 20 acre property to clear the 4 wheeler trails, and besides it is not recommended to use more than 200 feet of extension cords from what I have read. I might have to try loading the generator on the trailer this spring.
customer_reviews.author: strbrite

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER Electric Chainsaw, 18-Inch, 15-Amp (CS1518)
product_meta.description: Style:ChainsawThe Black & Decker CS1518 15amp 18 Corded Chainsaw offers a 15 Amp powerful motor for large branches and demanding cuts. This chain saw has an 18 Oregon low-kickback bar and chain for improved cutting performance. It offers tool-free chain tensioning for quick and easy chain adjustments, along with an automatic oiling system which ensures constant bar and chain lubrication. It has a clear window so you can monitor the oil levels and also has a chain break feature for optimal safety during usage. This is backed by Black & Decker's 2 year limited warranty. Included Components: (1) Scabbard; Power Source: Corded
feature_bullets: Chain break feature for safety during use

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars764 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
